listOfQuestions.question: What does EU stand for?
Which treaty established the European Union?
In which year was the Euro introduced?
How many member countries are in the EU as of 2023?
What is the capital of the European Union?
Which body of the EU represents the interests of the member states?
What is the main legislative body of the EU?
Which country was the first to join the EU?
Which of the following is NOT an EU institution?
What is the Schengen Area?
listOfQuestions.correctAnswer: A group of countries allowing free movement across their borders

listOfQuestions.question: Which of the following countries is NOT a member of the EU?
What is the purpose of the European Commission?
listOfQuestions.correctAnswer: To propose legislation and enforce EU law

listOfQuestions.question: Which document outlines the values and objectives of the EU?
What is the Eurozone?
listOfQuestions.correctAnswer: The group of EU countries that use the Euro

listOfQuestions.question: Which city is known as the de facto capital of the EU?
Which of the following is a goal of the EU?
What is the function of the European Court of Justice?
listOfQuestions.correctAnswer: To ensure EU law is interpreted and applied consistently

listOfQuestions.question: Which treaty amended the structure of the EU in 2009?
What is the Common Agricultural Policy?
listOfQuestions.correctAnswer: An EU policy aimed at supporting farmers and promoting sustainable agriculture

listOfQuestions.question: Which institution is responsible for the EU's budget?
What is the EU's motto?
wrongAnswers: One for all, all for one

listOfQuestions.question: Which of the following is a criterion for EU membership?
Which country is set to join the EU in the near future?
What is the function of the European Ombudsman?
listOfQuestions.correctAnswer: To investigate complaints about maladministration in EU institutions

listOfQuestions.question: Which EU program aims to promote research and innovation?
What is the size of the European Parliament?
Which of the following is NOT an EU official language?
What is the main purpose of the European Social Fund?
listOfQuestions.correctAnswer: To promote employment and social inclusion

listOfQuestions.question: Which of the following countries adopted the Euro first?
What does the European Central Bank do?
listOfQuestions.correctAnswer: Manages the Euro and EU monetary policy

listOfQuestions.question: Which EU program allows students to study abroad?
What does the Council of the EU do?
listOfQuestions.correctAnswer: Represents the governments of EU member states

listOfQuestions.question: What is the role of the European Parliament in the EU legislative process?
listOfQuestions.correctAnswer: Co-decides legislation with the Council of the EU

listOfQuestions.question: Which of the following is an EU agency?
What is the main focus of the EU's Green Deal?
listOfQuestions.correctAnswer: To make Europe climate neutral by 2050

listOfQuestions.question: Which country was the last to join the EU as of 2023?
What is the Eurobarometer?
listOfQuestions.correctAnswer: A series of public opinion surveys conducted by the EU

listOfQuestions.question: What is the main goal of the EU's Cohesion Policy?
listOfQuestions.correctAnswer: To reduce economic and social disparities between regions
wrongAnswers: To regulate trade between member states

listOfQuestions.question: Which of the following is a fundamental right protected by the EU?
